intro: Barlia cazorlensis, commonly known as the Cazorla bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in mountainous regions of southern Spain. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
